channel.title: Azure Resource Manager on PowerShell Magazine | For the most powerful community
channel.description: Recent content in Azure Resource Manager on PowerShell Magazine | For the most powerful community

item.title: Getting Started with PSArm
item.description: In the first part of this series, you learned about PSArm – a PowerShell embedded DSL – that you can use to declaratively define your Azure infrastructure and generate an ARM template.

item.title: PSArm - PowerShell DSL For Azure Resource Manager - Introduction
item.description: Those who worked on Azure Resource Manager (ARM) templates understand that complexity of writing and making sure the template works as expected becomes very complicated as the complexity of a deployment grows.

item.title: Deploy Custom Azure Automation Integration Modules Using ARM Templates
item.description: Update: Earlier generic linked template for deploying modules was removed and it was breaking my ARM template. I published two linked templates in my ARMSeries repo that can be used to deploy modules to Azure Automation accounts.
